So it was a meeting that we had some people from the adopt center orders from OSSI and two other government organizations within Ireland called the Central Statistics Office and the Department of Public Expenditure and Reform.
And from this meeting there was two use cases that were identified.
One was that any boundary than it does to be published is to be published with multiple different resolutions of the boundary Geometry's.

An on areas.

They require boundaries at different resolutions, so for example, to see us over Central Statistics Office in Ireland requires boundary data would be to be at the 20 metre resolution, whereas information exchange and the European level requires areas and boundaries to be in the 100 meter resolution.
So the idea of this use case are this.
This requirement really is to provide greater interoperability then between different organizations which are looking to utilize this data.

2nd second requirement then was to be able to capture the history and provenance, then of changes to boundaries so boundaries can change overtime due to things such as like coastal erosion or 1 two areas might marriage or and there you might split up the ladder kind of changes usually come about through a piece of legal legislation within Ireland at peace.
Allegedly legislation is called the statutory instrument and really statutory instruments describe how.
Really add to how and why were the reasons for a boundary being changed or altered so that uses the captured history and provenance.
Then to capture the information of a statutory instrument and also the history then of boundary changes.
